oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Union Station in Chattanooga
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interior view of the south end of the Terminal Station in Chattanooga, showing the interior of the main waiting room, facing the doors that lead to Market Street and the main entrance.
Terminal Station opened in 1909. Construction of the station cost a total of $1,500,000. Donn Barber from New York City was the station's architect and designed the station in the Beaux-Arts-style.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Railroad stations--Tennessee
Railroad stations; Railroad facilities; Windows; Doors & doorways; Architecture
